title: Understanding Equilibrium
text: Equilibrium is reached when the rate of the forward reaction equals the rate of the reverse reaction. This means the concentrations of reactants and products remain constant over time.

title: Observing Changes Over Time
text: Look at how the number of each type of particle changes from t0 to t3 in each system. Equilibrium is indicated by no further change in the number of particles.

title: System I Analysis
text: In System I, observe the changes in the number of blue circles, purple squares, and orange ovals from t0 to t3. Do they stabilize at any point?

title: System II Analysis
text: In System II, check if the number of each type of particle remains constant from t0 to t3. This would indicate equilibrium.

title: System III Analysis
text: In System III, observe if the number of blue circles, purple squares, and orange ovals remain constant from t0 to t3. This would suggest the system is at equilibrium.
